verses.plain: And Job answered and said,

tokens.t: And Job answered and said,

verses.plain: No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.

tokens.t: No doubt but ye
the people, and wisdom shall die with you.

verses.plain: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?

tokens.t: But I have understanding as well as you; I
not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?

verses.plain: I am as one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.

tokens.t: I am
one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright
laughed to scorn.

verses.plain: He that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.

tokens.t: He that is ready to slip with
feet
a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.

verses.plain: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.

tokens.t: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth

verses.plain: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:

tokens.t: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:

verses.plain: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.

tokens.t: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.

verses.plain: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the LORD hath wrought this?

tokens.t: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the
hath wrought this?

verses.plain: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.

tokens.t: In whose hand
the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.

verses.plain: Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?

tokens.t: Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?

verses.plain: With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.

tokens.t: With the ancient
wisdom; and in length of days understanding.

verses.plain: With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.

tokens.t: With him
wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.

verses.plain: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.

tokens.t: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.

verses.plain: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

tokens.t: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

verses.plain: With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.

tokens.t: With him
strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver
his.

verses.plain: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.

tokens.t: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.

verses.plain: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.

tokens.t: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.

verses.plain: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.

tokens.t: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.

verses.plain: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.

tokens.t: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.

verses.plain: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.

tokens.t: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.

verses.plain: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.

tokens.t: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.

verses.plain: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them again.

tokens.t: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them

verses.plain: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.

tokens.t: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness
no way.

verses.plain: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.

tokens.t: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like
drunken

footnotes.text: I am…: Heb. I fall not lower than you
who…: Heb. with whom are not such as these?
all…: Heb. all flesh of man
speech…: Heb. lip of the faithful
weakeneth…: or, looseth the girdle of the strong
